subject: Re: [junit] generate offline reports
msgSnippet: ... Where can you learn about those ant parameters? Is it something ant specific or specific to junit ? urls/pointers please appreciated :) Is that
messageBody:
<snip>

> To add to that, here's my ant target for junit:
>
> <!-- the junit/cactus test definitions -->
> <target name="test_definitions">
> <junit
> printsummary="withOutAndErr"
> fork="no"
> haltonfailure="no">
> <formatter type="xml" />
> <test name="sinfo.jsp.utils.JSPUtilsTestSuite" />
> <test name="sinfo.tm.TMTestSuite" />
> <test name="sinfo.pid.PIDTestSuite" />
> <test name="sinfo.optiontabler.utils.OptionTablerUtilsTestSuite" />
> </junit>
> <junitreport todir="${test.results.dir}">
> <fileset dir="${src}" includes="TEST-*.xml"/>
> <report format="noframes" todir="${test.results.dir}"/>
> </junitreport>
> </target>
>
>
> The target runs the tests and generates a report based on all the
> TEST-*.xml files that it finds in the directory ${src}.
>
>

Where can you learn about those ant parameters? Is it something ant
specific or specific to junit ? urls/pointers please appreciated :)

Is that something specific to cactus?

thanks

dof.


--
